description: Borrowed from Latin perpendere, from per- + pendere (“to weigh”).

verbs.description: perpend (third-person singular simple present perpends, present participle perpending, simple past and past participle perpended)

description: From Middle French parpain, see etymology of French parpaing.

entries.meaning: A brick or stone that has its longest dimension perpendicular to the face of a wall, especially one that extends through the wall's entire thickness.
A vertical joint (usually mortar) between bricks or blocks in a horizontal course.
